title: Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) - internal documentation
personalDataVerified: Subject names, transaction details, suspicion basis, filing date, compliance officer
personalDataVisible: Link to compliance department system (senior management and auditors, requires authentication)
rationale: Internal compliance records documenting SAR filing decisions (not the filed SARs themselves which are confidential to FinCEN). Domain binding verifies compliance department. Tamper-evident internal audit trail. Proves SAR filing occurred for regulatory examinations. Critical for BSA compliance where financial institutions must maintain records of suspicious activity detection and reporting.
